data.title: The Theater that was Rome
data.text:
Farnese, Odoardo (1573-1626)

Variant Names

first variant

second variant

Dates

b. 1573, Parma

d. 1626, Panna

Occupation(s)

Cardinal (1591)

Duke of Parma and Piacenza

Bishop of Tuscolo, Sabina and Frascati

Odoardo Farnese

Born in Parma to Duke Alessandro Farnese and Maria of Portugal, Odoardo was sent to Rome in 1580 to study with Fulvio Orsini. He became a Cardinal in 1591, and was an active patron of the arts. In Rome, he had the use of the Palazzo Farnese, the Villa Farnesina, the Farnese gardens on the Palatine Hill, and the villa in Caprarola. It was at his invitation that Annibale, Agostino and Ludovico Carracci came from Bologna to decorate the great salone of the Palazzo Farnese in 1594.

He was buried in Rome, in the church of the Ges√π.

E.L.
